title: BoiCrypto
author: BoiCrypto
content: I’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance

comments.author: EL MOHA
comments.body: Welcome to the forum, let me help with some links to threads that will help guide you on the forum. Here is thread on rules guiding the forumYou can also read about bitcoin on learnmeabitcoin.comYou can also learn about bitcoin wallets and their differences through this thread Wallets- Which, what and WhyIf you have any questions you’re free to ask but before proceeding you can use the search function to search first. How to effectively use the search function

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: Welcome to the forum! You can start by reading these two threads :1. Newbies - Read before posting2. Merit & new rank requirementsRemember palagarised content will eventually lead to a permanent ban. Always give due credits to someone else content if you need their content for reference. Be active and if you have any doubts do ask questions.

comments.author: Dzwaafu11
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance You are welcome to the bitcointalk forum, where all bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are discussed. However,  don’t hesitate to ask any questions you don’t understand; the forum men are always active to help beginners that join the forum. And if you obey the rules and regulations governing the forum, you canclick newbies read before postingYou can also use beginners encyclopedia by Ratimov it helps the novice wellNOTE Plagiarism is what causes many newcomers that are joining the forum to get their accounts banned, so try as much as you can to avoid that. If you don’t understand something, no one will force you to discuss it. You can move to another thread and give your own idea, so avoid using someone's idea and claiming it as your own or copying something from the internet and pasting it here.

comments.author: yudi09
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance Aside from the rules you need to know Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ, make it a habit to use the search field to find things you need, like when you want to make a post like this.Welcome to the bitcoin forum, BoiCryptoI recommend that you deepen your knowledge of how to use wallets and wallet security before starting to invest and trade.Make this forum an initial means for you to learn about bitcoin and other cryptos besides taking advantage of other learning spaces.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance Welcome to Bitcointalk, I think you have gotten enough links already that will get you started on the forum including the forum’s rules so do well to go through the thread.Aside from that you should also learn how to use the search option properly, because as you continue your journey you’ll surely come across some terms of functionality that you know nothing about or that you don’t seem to grasp the concept you can always use the search function in the forum to check if it has already been explained before you proceed to creating a new thread for it.  [Tutorial] Advanced Google Search (Dorking) [Guide] Searching effectively

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.All the information you need to be guided has been dropped here, I advised you to check all of these links and spend time reading and absorbing them so you will not be lost and you can post with confidence here, and when it comes to Bitcoin I always recommend reading Bitcoin Whitepaper highly recommend to read the original work of Satoshi Nakamoto first.For a simple explanation of that Whitepaper I recommend this readingThe Bitcoin Whitepaper simply explained.

comments.author: DYING_S0UL
comments.body: Your every questions answer is here:

comments.author: reagansimms
comments.body: Welcome to the Bitcointalk Forums. This is your first post after joining the Forum, you should read one by one the Comments from Seniors after asking questions through this topic. What you need has been explained and you are also directed to several topics that are useful for your development while on the Bitcointalk forum.Read one by one the topics that have been recommended for you, then learn, understand and avoid all that is prohibited. Actually it's not difficult to understand how to forum properly, leave what is prohibited and do something that can help other members on the forum, with a good contribution to the forum you will spend more time on the forum because you already know what advantages you can take from the forum.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance All your questions have been answered. If you learn how to search for your question correctly, you will find the answer. I advise you to read this topic --->  Searching effectivelyRead BitcoinTalk rules ---> Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ Don't plagiarize, scam, spam and always ask any question after you do a search and don't find an answer (no matter how silly the question is) and then you'll be a good member.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: The links are already provided to you in the previous replies. You need to spend a little time reading certain advice, rules, and basic dos and don'ts. If possible, do that before making posts to avoid newbie mistakes that might cost you your account or your reputation. But, as a newbie, I guess the natural thing to do first is explore, read, and observe how things are generally done here. Welcome to the forum and enjoy your stay!

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Welcome to the forum, buddy. As all links have already been given by previous members, I hope you find the time to read through them. These days, it's easier to see newbies create threads and ask questions and seek enlightenment about things on the forum, but I doubt if they usually come back to their threads and see if they get what they were really expecting from other members, as I can see that newbies have turned this pattern into a means of introducing themselves as having arrived on the forum. Adding to what others have said, the forum is very simple to explore, just like a normal gathering will be; you don't expect everyone to respect your opinion, and you are always entitled to your own opinion, so just be yourself, and if you come here with good intentions, you are definitely going to enjoy this forum. And last but not least, you have to grow some thick skin as you might come across some comments and opinions from other members that you might consider a direct attack, which it might not be, but for you to be able to survive here, you don't need to worry about those and always pick out any vital information from where necessary and leave the rest.

comments.author: isaac_clarke22
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance Welcome, OP! Pretty much everything has been mentioned here in the thread. Any other links are just up to your own discoveries since there are way too many stuffs to cover around the forum such as what's promoted and frowned upon in here.I hope you have a wonderful time around the forum!  Feel free to ask questions in here, but just make sure you had searched of the answers first before creating a thread.Best of luck, OP!

comments.author: aylabadia05
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance First, when your position is logged in, point the cursor to the search menu. Enter a search word there. If the one you want is available, don't create a new one.Second, the meta board provides discussion around the forum. When you are there, there are several topics that are marked as pinned. Read and understand everything.Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PMForum rules1. No zero or low value, pointless or uninteresting posts or threads. [1][e]2. No off-topic posts.3. No trolling.4. No referral code (ref link) spam. [1]5. No link shorteners that require users to view an ad.6. No linking to phishing or malware, without a warning and a valid reason. [e]7. No begging. [5]8. No threats to inflict bodily harm, death threats.9. Discussions in the main boards must be in english. All other language discussions should be posted in the appropriate Local board.10. No embedded NSFW images anywhere. NSFW content must be marked accordingly.11. No linking to illegal trading sites.12. No duplicate posting in multiple boards (except for re-posting topics in the local language boards if they're translated and re-posting marketplace topics in the altcoin boards if altcoins are accepted).13. Bumps, "updates" are limited to once per 24 hours per thread. Bumping multiple threads at the same time is allowed if it's not annoying. [2][e]14. All altcoin related discussion belong in the Alternate cryptocurrencies and its child boards. [3][4][e]15. No on-forum altcoin giveaways. [6][e]16. Do not have more than one active sales topic in the Currency exchange board. [3]17. Trading of goods that are illegal in the seller's or buyer's country is forbidden. [2]18. Having multiple accounts and account sales are allowed, but account sales are discouraged.19. Possible (or real) scams and Trust ratings are not moderated (to prevent moderation abuse).20. There are restrictions when selling accounts and invites for invite-only sites. See https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=134779.0 [2][?]21. Old bumps should be deleted. [2]22. Advertising (this includes mining pools, gambling services, exchanges, shops, etc.) in others' threads is no longer allowed, including, but not limited to, in altcoin announcement threads. [8]23. When deciding if a user has broken the rules, the staff have the right to follow their interpretation of the rules.[e]24. Advertisements (including signatures within the post area) in posts aren't allowed unless the post is in a thread you started and is really substantial and useful.[9][e]25. Ban evasion (using or creating accounts while one of your accounts is banned) is not allowed.[e]26. Local thread rules, if stated properly when the thread was started, specific enough and don't conflict with the forum rules, have to be followed.[e]27. Using automated translation tools to post translated content in Local boards is not allowed.28. Exploiting bugs or flaws (even if the result is harmless) in the forum's software is not allowed.29. Sending unsolicited PMs, including but not limited to advertising and flood, is not allowed.30. Similar marketplace items must be listed together.[2][e]31. User avatars must not contain NSFL or NSFW content, infringe on copyright or attempt to impersonate a user.[10]32. Posting multiple posts in a row (excluding bumps and reserved posts by the thread starter) is not allowed.33. Posting plagiarized content is not allowed.[e]

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Welcome mate.You are in the right place to learn all angles of bitcoin based on the area that you are cool with. You have been provided with so much articles for you to read so that you can have the basic knowledge of bitcoin and to know how things are done on the forum.You should use the search engine to get answers of your questions and to also see if similar topic has been created before creating yours. You should also take your time to navigate round the various boards in the forum to find the boards of your interest. Read more and post less at this stage and always do your own research on topics before coming to conclusion.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: Welcome, yesterday I made a post on how you can use the advanced google search if you don't want to use the In-built forum search feature. Here is the link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5464746It will allow you to search efficiently for anything related to Bitcoin and also, the basics of Bitcoin can be cleared by watching some great already existing tutorials on YouTube. There are tons of beginner friendly videos or guides available, and you can even use ChatGPT to answer you some basic questions. For any advanced concept, you can always use this forum.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance Here are few tips that could guide you through the forum and the summary is in two phases i will like to tell you, always read the forums rules and regulations and keep them in mind and don't plagiarize while onbthis forum, you should have learning as your first hubby to progress with your stay here a d make it worth it.Helpful threads.Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0posting etiquetteshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5184741.0#post_altgiveawayeverything you need to know about forum rank, activities and merits.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2766177.0bitcoin historyhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5438353.0Beginners and Help Encyclopediahttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5364418.0Welcome to bitcointalk.

comments.author: ololajulo
comments.body: Avoid plagiarism as much as possible, read this to help against it: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5133485.0

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance You are very fortunate to be here, OP, and I am certain you will find all of the information you need about Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies because it is the primary objective of this forum.Many links have been supplied to guide you in order to prevent any offence in this forum, and as others have stated, make sure you avoid plagiarism because it is a serious offence here in the forum, and the penalty is to ban any person who is involved in plagiarism.Furthermore, there are numerous categories here in the forum, including local boards, to help us, the forum users, obtain knowledge and learn quickly.

comments.author: GiftedMAN
comments.body: Quote from: BoiCrypto on August 29, 2023, 09:54:24 AMI’m a brand new in the forum so please I want the senior member to help me out on how I can operate in forum without offense and some links that I can use to read about bitcoin.Thanks in advance Welcome on board. Seeing that the answers to what you seek has been provided by other forum members already, it is your responsibility as a newcomer to make effective use of the informations provided to explore the forum not forgetting the rules which should be your primary assignment to read and understand before you proceed to the learning process. Giving your time to reading the links provided will surely make things easier for you don't forget to also engage in personal research just incase you get confused during your time of reading the comments of other members and make use of the search colum as provided by@DYING_SOUL for fast answers to your questions.
